website_summaries.verdict: This adaptable inline duct fan is the perfect choice for indoor growing spaces because of its easy installation, compact design, adjustable fan speeds, and subdued noise levels.
pros: Durable construction resists extreme heat and humidity
Speed controller adjusts for 3 blowing speeds
Mounting bracket can be attached to walls, ceilings, or floors
cons: Note that it’s a low-noise inline vent fan, not a silent one, and VIVOSUN offers a matching silencer to dramatically reduce noise levels even further

customer_reviews.title: Shocking!
customer_reviews.text: Fan works well. Was very quiet for the first few weeks (which was truly encouraging), but slowly developed an internal wobble (like every other fan I've ever owned) and now it makes noise. I also discovered that the fan is creating an external electrical current that is being carried by the ducting. If you touch the ducting, you will get a mild shock. It's not enough to start a fire, but it is enough to make you jump. Now, here's the cool part... I described these problems to Vivosun and they had a brand new fan at my door in two days! What? Who does that? Great service. I'll let you know how the fan holds up. :)
customer_reviews.author: G. Holt Webb

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere, horrible quality, will not last.
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how this has an average rating of 4 stars, I have now received 6 or 7 of these in the past few months and every one of them lasts a week to 2 months before the bearing/bushing is completely shot, the whole fan mechanism wobbles/makes tons of noise. Absolutely awful build quality for a day or three works and sounds great though! ** Vivosun contacted me about the issues, see response below.. raising star rating based on the customer service alone.. hopefully they sort out manufacturing problems.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Great unit. It really sucks
customer_reviews.text: Great unit. It really sucks. Using it with a laser cutter to extract fumes and it's great. Very quiet, low vibration, and high flow. Had to make a special bracket to mount it in vertical airflow setup but includes a bracket that should work fine for horizontal flow, assuming it is attached to a stud or something. Takes a long time to spin up and spin down...not a big deal but something to consider if you plan on using it for non-continuous fume extraction.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Kummer

customer_reviews.title: Fan air output is good for this size
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this as model spray booth exhaust fan and it works well for what I need. Fan air output is good for this size. The speed controller does slow it down a bit which is a nice feature. It does move out a lot of air which is what I need when airbrush spraying. My compressor is louder than this fan but it does generate some noise but it's not an major issue for me. It's also well balance as I have a stand that it's mounted to and there is no vibration whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: EndoT800

customer_reviews.title: Good air flow but very short power cord.
customer_reviews.text: The air flow is great, it keeps my 4x4 right in check for temps. The variable speed is nice too. My biggest issue is the short cord. I always have to bring in an extra extension cord or power strip to have an outlet close enough to hang this at the top of the tent. More cables means higher fire hazard and more mess. I hate having to buy a 2 foot extensions just to get this to my power source or having power strips hanging in the air from being pulled to their max length.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable in my experience.  DOA on 2nd power-up
customer_reviews.text: I turned it on when I received it and it worked OK. The speed control barely made a difference in the speed of the fan, but it worked. I set it aside until I could gather what I needed to send air outdoors. I wanted to test it a second time before installation, and it is dead as aa door nail. Wonderful....... Now I suppose I have to go through the hassle of hoping for an exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Smith

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy from Amazon if you want a warranty
customer_reviews.text: So very disappointed with this fan quit after 8 months of use an vivosun is unwilling to do anything as far as a warranty cause I bought it on Amazon completely unacceptable will no longer be spending any money on Vivosun products
customer_reviews.author: travis bingham

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this fan
customer_reviews.text: I dont recommend this fan- dont waste your money! I purchased this 6" fan to pull air out of my grow tent. Worked great, definitely controlled the pungent odors from my plants. I run the fan during daytime when my lights stay on. After a month of use, the fan is now making a loud noise. I still only run it 18 hrs a day although I don't believe it will last another 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: regnar88

customer_reviews.title: Cheap bearings
customer_reviews.text: Works great for a month or so, then the bearings go out. Spend a few more bucks on the Hydrofarm one. I bought two VivoSuns and two Hydrofarms, both vivosuns are making a lot of noise while the hydros are still quiet.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 10 months
customer_reviews.text: The fan worked well for about 8 months, then started to become noisy. At 9 months it was obvious that it won't last much longer and it completely stopped working one day. You could hear that it is about to die, which was a good thing and I was prepared. It said it had a 3 year warranty. Contacted the seller and got a response asking for a serial number. Will update how that went. I suppose shipping will be more expensive than buying a new one.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: There should be a design to run quieter.
customer_reviews.text: So the main thing that this product brings to my attention is the noise level I live in a studio apartment so my TV and my grow tent are next to each other and it completely drowns it out the TV. I don't mean to write this product so badly but because of the noise level and the fans that I use personally in my home for myself feel just about the same. If you are looking to expel out of your tent this would be a good product for you but I am worth considering importing fresh air
customer_reviews.author: Justin Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Decent fan
customer_reviews.text: I used it for exhaust on a 80w laser cutter. Running through a small filter box. It does an OK job...not as good as the fan it replaced, but MUCH quieter. I can watch youtube on my laptop with it running right next to me...the old fan sounded like a professional grade leaf blower. They also make an 8 inch version that I used on another laser cutter at a makerspace...I probably should have purchased another one of those with a 6-8 inch adapter, but hind sight is 20-20 I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Kummer

customer_reviews.title: Good job sucking out the hot air of my grow
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, couple weeks using it now. My tent was heating up to high 80’s. I bought this and it’s on the lowest setting and holding temp around 74. As far as noise..constant hum but once I close the door to the room I have my grow in, can’t hear anything. Mounting bracket came with it but I used a piece of styrofoam to just stand it on. Stands up on its own with duct work holding it steady. On the wood floor there was some vibrations I could hear but the styrofoam that came in the box took care of absorbing that.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Parts Wear Out in 1 year it seems, buy an active air instead
customer_reviews.text: Sounds like a ball bearing on the 6” has worn out completely after just 1 year of light use in a 4x8. Completely unuseable the sound is unbearably loud. Also wasn’t very powerful even at full load, but was very loud. My 8” is only a few months old and is also making a low volume grinding sound that I suspect is the same part wearing out that will soon be the end of it as well. The 8” is OK in power at full but still very loud. Never using a Vivosun again, my active air is 4 years old and as quiet and powerful as the day I got it, just wish it was adjustable!
customer_reviews.author: A. Z. T.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! But failing after a year.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for a year now. It has been running 24/7 since I installed it. I have been extremely happy with it until about a week ago it started making a faint grinding noise. The noise has progressively gotten worse. I think the bearings are going bad. Now I have to decide if I should and am capable of replacing the bearings or buying a new fan. I’m giving this a low rating due to the short life of the product.
customer_reviews.author: ASAN

customer_reviews.title: Good fan for money
customer_reviews.text: Good fan. Good flow , like the built in speed control and the cover for the fan seems to help keep the noise down however after a period of time it has developed a high pitched whine. Doesn’t matter what speed the fan is running at the noise is there after fan has been on for a couple of minutes. Doesn’t seem to affect performance just and irritating sound, we’re it not for that the fan would be very quiet and I would have easily given it a five star review
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: It sucks
customer_reviews.text: This fan sucks ... or blows ... depending on which end you are at but in THIS case (either way you look at it ... or run it) it is a very GOOD thing. This is my second purchase. If anyone has ever read my reviews on other purchases than you know that I am real and particular (I guess I am really particular). In order to get 5 stars on a product this would mean that there is absolutely NO room for improvement. I rarely give 5 stars so a 4 star rating is just about the best you can get (which is darn good).
customer_reviews.author: jburton1963

customer_reviews.title: Died in less than 3 months
customer_reviews.text: The fan worked great for less than 3 months. Got home and it was stopped making a loud buzzing noise and was VERY hot. For nearly $80 I expected it to last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: relatively quiet
customer_reviews.text: For the amount of air they push, these things are pretty quiet. We have them in our hair salon and you can talk over them, with 2 fans running. You definitely know they are there though. Variable speed is great. Some customers complained it didn't work. It DID work for me. Mounting bracket is a big strange. You have to diagonal drill your bolts because the fan is in the way for a square installment. For the price, I think they are great.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Baca

customer_reviews.title: Not so good vibrations but decent.
customer_reviews.text: Powerful. Do what you want them to. Using to boost air to a second floor handler. Appear to be made well. I’ve had mine installed less than two weeks. One of the two is starting to make a subtle vibration/rumble/hum. Seems to be a common issue from the reviews. Kind of disappointed. Variable control works well so far but I generally leave them on high and pair with a wireless thermostat. Not sure if I’ll keep them or try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Nate David

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: This certainly moves a reasonable amount of air. Has a handy built in speed controller. The noise level is a little louder than you'd wish it was but it's never going to be completely quiet and it fades into the background quickly. Probably as loud in a room as most HVAC forced air fans would sound.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great fan for this price
customer_reviews.text: Perfect cooling for a 600w HID hood. I use this on the highest setting and not too loud noise wise considering it is rated for 440cfm. I had to put tape around where the power box is mounted to the fan, it had air coming out and would of been easier to mount if hung instead of bolted because not much room between the mount and fan body but great fan this price
customer_reviews.author: RONALD

customer_reviews.title: Too Loud! Didn't make any noise at first but then started knocking and loud after a very short time on.
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the one thing I've bought that was so upsetting when it didn't work the way it should. Right after a very short time of having it on,about 2 weeks,it just gradually got louder and louder. It started almost knocking. We took it down and looked at it,there really wasn't anything to clean out. But it was so loud you could hear it really well all over my crib . I was super disappointed about this one.
customer_reviews.author: Chad& Nichole

customer_reviews.title: Running Well, and Quiet.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this very skeptically since I have read reviews of other inline fans with similar price-points get bad reviews on Amazon. I needed a solid fan that was quiet. I decided to try this since it had a built in speed control. I am extremely happy with the quality and the sound. I run this at about 1/2 speed, and makes less noise than a traditional box fan on low. So far this has been running in a 70 degree, indoor environment for about 18 hr per day. I will update once this has some hours under it's belt.
customer_reviews.author: RWC

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 3 years
customer_reviews.text: Fan worked great for the first 6 months. Slowly started to develop a rattling sound which got louder and louder until the unit finialy quit. It did last for 3 years so I wouldn’t say it’s a bad fan. Just not a long term investment. It did what it was required to do and for that I am thankful.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 3 days
customer_reviews.text: Fan looks good, install was easy, relatively quiet for how much air it moved. But it failed after 3 days. Luckily it didn't happen during the middle of the day when heat builds up in the tent. Very frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Islander

customer_reviews.title: LOUD and heavy but strong, but after a few months making excessive noise.
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with it at first but after a few months it's become extremely loud to where I got a different fan because it was so loud I couldn't sleep, and the noise sounded possibly dangerous so I just turned it off and got a different one. I don't know if something's wrong with it or if it's shaking itself apart which is what it sounds like. It is very powerful though. I've bought a lot of VIVOSUN products and they've been hit or miss, unfortunately this one has been more of a miss I think.
customer_reviews.author: Reynard Winters

customer_reviews.title: Bringing my bills down
customer_reviews.text: It's not super loud, but you definitely know when it's on. It circulates a fair amount of air, during my winter and summer months its made a 10-20° difference in my household (depending on the extremity of the weather).
customer_reviews.author: Adam O.

customer_reviews.title: Very good product.  Always go with Vivosun.
customer_reviews.text: So I purchased this inline fan a few weeks ago. Too me a bit to install it as I really didn’t NEED it in the space at the time. Super easy to set up. Pretty self explanatory actually. I just hung mine from the support bars with two zip ties. The speed control on this particular model is kinda nice. Makes for a more compact setup.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Quite and powerful.
customer_reviews.text: Appears very well built. Super quite and powerful! We use it in our Spa for acrylic fume venting.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle

customer_reviews.title: Well balanced fan
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this to push the air through my carbon filter. The noise level is extremely low, the only noise you really do hear is the air moving. This fan is powerful! The speed control is very convenient and added on bonus that saves you a good $20. The speed controller also has an off on switch that I find a great option.
customer_reviews.author: T.E.G

customer_reviews.title: Very loud after just 3 monthes
customer_reviews.text: Bought in sept of 2017. Installed end of Novembso and here I am in the beginning of march with my fan literally sounding like a diesel truck. Bought this because its the quietest on amazon but what does that matter if it only works for 3 months? Very unhappy. EDIT: VIVOSUN without a doubt has great customer service. They contacted me and gave me a full refund. I feel as though alot of other companies wouldnt have done this. I have updated from a 1 star review to 3. Thanks VIVOSUN
customer_reviews.author: M.G.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design and craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: ***UPDATE*** Fan is no longer working properly. Company unresponsive.*** I would NOT recommend this fan. No real ability to adjust. unit must be on High to start? this is Very BAD. now I can't hook it up to my automatic temp controller. and this thing is at least 2x louder than my existing 800cfm.
customer_reviews.author: C. Catalano

customer_reviews.title: Nice fan
customer_reviews.text: This thing is quiet. It makes noise but its air movement noise, not motor. Moves a lot of air even on low. I will have to see how hot it gets running 24/7 and how long it will last but for now a solid 5 stars. UPDATE: I'm around the four year mark since i bought this fan and my 5 star rating is holding up. It has been running almost non-stop since I bought it and it is still just as quiet, moves just a much air (a lot) and is just barely warm to the touch. I'm very happy with this purchase and would definitely buy another when the time comes.
customer_reviews.author: damien summers

customer_reviews.title: Great product packaging well and working great
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to be able to evacuate my garage from the ceiling during the summer when it got hot. It works great my only suggestion would be that the lid on the intake side be a little deeper. Other than that I would highly recommend this item
customer_reviews.author: OCVincent

customer_reviews.title: Designed for full speed starts. Might not be what you’re looking for.
customer_reviews.text: They need to state in the description that the fan needs to be started at full speed and then set to the desired speed. If you need it to turn on automatically at anything but full speed this is problematic.
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey bolduc

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and hardly vibrates
customer_reviews.text: Exceptionally quiet. It’s difficult to tell if it’s even on in a workshop environment (laser cutter exhaust connected to exterior window). Doesn’t even vibrate much and is very effective at removing laser cutter smoke from cutting chamber.
customer_reviews.author: Jason W. Tapia

customer_reviews.title: Bearings are failing after just one month of use 😫
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: full refund.. no issues. But so annoying.. I went with hyperfan instead I was really excited when I first got I this. The speed controller was a nice touch.. seemed to be decent quality.. but now.. I am really disappointed. I've had this fan running for 1 month and tonight the bearings are failing. It's really loud now. Totally bummed..
customer_reviews.author: Tywang

customer_reviews.title: Looks Used. Missing Parts
customer_reviews.text: Looks used. No mounting bracket. Couldn't figure out what VIVOSUN wanted so I could get the part sent to me. Returning it. New tent setup, no fan to exhaust it. Couldn't hang it, can't say how well it works.
customer_reviews.author: Hatchet

customer_reviews.title: Hit or miss..
customer_reviews.text: First one I had lasted almost 2 years then began emitting a unbearable high pitch squeal so I ordered another one the second one lasted just over 4 months before the squeal began.. Took it apart to try and oil it up, but as far as I can tell there is no way of getting to the bearings to add oil.. So I guess it's just hit or miss with this company..
customer_reviews.author: Evergreen Vape & Glass LLC

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last , not dependable.
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for just about a year and then the noise started , so disappointed. Fan makes a Rattling sound randomly at different intervals one on for long periods tried mounting it differently still made same noise and of course out of warranty now.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel G Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Was happy until...
customer_reviews.text: Was initially very pleased with the fan and the amount of air it pulled. But after a couple months it has started to get loud internally. Sounds like a grinding maybe, not sure. Have to give a 2 out of 5 stars. EDIT: 5/28 Vivosun replied back and offered a full refund. I was worried cause shipping back would be kind of expensive i think. But they said they didn't want/need the old one back. Going to 4 out of 5 stars for the customer service. Will purchase from Vivosun again. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: b grow

customer_reviews.title: Fan volume is louder than stated
customer_reviews.text: The 6in version of this fan is louder than 50db. It averaged around 79db (low), to 89db (high). While it seemed like a good fan... well built... good air flow, it was too loud for our usage (the fan I presently use is around 67db). I believe if mounted in some remote situation, it would perform beautifully. Too bad for me... I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom B.

customer_reviews.title: My vivosun equipment was broken when I got it!
customer_reviews.text: Very pissed off, I spent $1,200 on almost complete vivosun indoor grow tent& set up on May 1st I believe, and just now getting around to setting it up today on July 9th and mine 6 inch exhaust fan and carbon filter are both bent to hell, my exhaust fan won’t even circulate it’s so bad it gets stuck and I went to see if I can exchange it and it says return window is closed May 31!!! I think I’m done useing vivosun and Amazon all together, We spend more money using Amazon because it’s easier to shop from one place, but shit like this Makes it not so easy
customer_reviews.author: jeffwalton

customer_reviews.title: this would be a great fan.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a quiet exhaust fan for my laser. This works well enough for that purpose. The noise level is very low. The CFMs are marginally acceptable. Once I move and am able to use a louder fan, I will be replacing this a higher CFM fan. For it original intended purpose, this would be a great fan.
customer_reviews.author: LinckG

customer_reviews.title: Great proiduct.
customer_reviews.text: This Is a very quiet variable speed commercial quality fan.Very well balanced low vibration blade I feel that can last for years. completely satisfied with this purchase. And yea this will move some air I have it hooked up to two smaller tents running on low speed and could easily add a third. When I need anything I check this brand and seller first.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Worst thing I have ever bought from Vivosun
customer_reviews.text: Would give 0 stars if possible plugged and immediately almost burnt my house down. Extremely poor quality!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Dean

customer_reviews.title: Can’t be perfect every time but close
customer_reviews.text: First not five star rating for this great company but let me say why. First off product came in perfectly packaged and looks well built. I ran it for a while and was very quite but then it started to shake a little and making a weird noise. I got a hold of Vivosun and they were great about it. I had a refund set to me very quickly and was able to purchase a new one right away. Very trouble free. The new one is quite as can be and runs very strong. Thanks again Vivosun for the great customer service and product
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great air mover needs a muffler :p
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a solid product that will last quite a while It is definitely not for any stealth operations Even on its lowest setting it is fairly loud I don't have a decibel meter but you could hear it standing outside of a room it's in for sure. On the other hand this thing moves air like no other If you're looking for a solid product to go ahead and pull the trigger this is it
customer_reviews.author: Honestly tho

customer_reviews.title: Good-ish
customer_reviews.text: I got the fan today and when i opened everything all up and plugged in. The fan seemed to be making a strange clicking noise like it was hitting the side. I turned it to low to see how strong the fan was, and it was strongish. But the clicking wasnt going away. So I turned it up a little, only to relize that the fan was making a really weird clicking noise now so i turned it off. Not to sure if i should return it and wait another 200 days for shipping or just roll with the punches. Fan seems strong enough for any kind of job though. I like vivosun but this is a bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This unit is a littler heavier than I expected but is well worth the money. Moves a lot of air and is quite quiet. Bench tested it prior to instillation. It was quiet clamped to a steel bench for a sound board and was still quiet. The variable speed was not an issue for me but the control worked well while on the bench. I expect to get years of service from it.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for 3 months. Bearing problems?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this unit after researching most of the available budget dect fan options. It was quite as i needed and worked just fine for the first three months of use, only 12 hours a day. After the third month is started to make a rattling scratching sound intermittently which slowly increased to almost constantly. I had this unit mounted suspended from my ceiling above the indoor garden, at level. Not tilted. So I took the unit down and made due for the fall. I will be inquiring about warrenty and returns.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Makes a noise like its underlubricated or off balance
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed overall, vivosun is usually better than this. The clacking noise it makes is very annoying and I'll be replacing this shortly.
customer_reviews.author: meredyth

customer_reviews.title: They all came undamaged with good documentation. Quality fans
customer_reviews.text: Bought a few of these, one has considerably more vibration than the others. Haven't contacted their customer service yet because it's not a real issue (yet), just noticeable. I'll update this review if I have to have a unit or two serviced. They all came undamaged with good documentation. Quality fans.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quiet with good air flow
customer_reviews.text: The unit is compact for the air flow it provides. Runs quite at any speed. No power on light, which can make it difficult to determine if unit is running when there is other noise in the area.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Exceeds expectations.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you can't beat this exhaust fan. Less then 100$ for an 8" that actually expells massive amounts of air. Yes it's loud. Any fan removing this much air is this loud. If you compare it to a 4" or 6", yes it's going to be louder, since the openings are larger (think acoustics). When hooked up to carbon filters and HPS hoods, this fan is much less loud and keeps the lights (hood, glass, and bulb) much cooler. When your room is cooler the electrical systems work more efficiently whilst also extending the life span of your bulbs (if used in a growing senario), which this fan does at an excellent price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fan died after 6 months BUT...
customer_reviews.text: After using the fan for 6 months, it has started making horrible noises indicating that the fan bearing is about to go. So if you want a fan that'll last only 6 months before dying, this is the one for you. UPDATE: Vivosun customer service was outstanding and sent me a replacement fan immediately. The new fan has been working flawlessly so far. I'll update again if it dies like the previous one.
customer_reviews.author: Rob D.

customer_reviews.title: Bearings inside fan do not last!
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t even last a year on a 12-12 schedule. It’s been 8 months and the bearing inside are rattling and it’s truest a terrible noise. Vivosun won’t send a replacement or respond to my inquiry. All and all, isn’t buy this in-line fan unless you want a Unreliable broken fan.
customer_reviews.author: William Mann

customer_reviews.title: This fan works great for my application paired with the VIVOSUN 6in Carbon ...
customer_reviews.text: This fan works great for my application paired with the VIVOSUN 6in Carbon filter. Unit was easy to install/mount and it provides good airflow. I had one issue with the fan after a while of use and I contacted support@vivosun.com for help. They were very responsive and provided great support several months after the sale. Very happy dealing with this company and I will order from them again.
customer_reviews.author: MarkD

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet duct fan.
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the 8 inch version. I have the six inch version as well, and let me tell you the 8 inch is significantly... And I mean SIGNIFICANTLY more quiet. It still makes fan noises, just not as loud as you expect with the volume if air it's pushing.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Chang

customer_reviews.title: Powerful fan
customer_reviews.text: This fan really moves the air. I'm using it in the winter to vent warm air from one end of the house to the other. We've really felt the difference. It's at least four times as powerful as our previous in line fan.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Houghtby

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased vivosun for sometime now and none of their inline fans last. I bought a 6" fan and it lasted 2 weeks. They replaced it and The new fan lasted about 1 1/2 months. Now I can't even get them to reply to me. Don't waste your time and money. Buy a AC infinity.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Brake

customer_reviews.title: sweet quality quite worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Quiet runner does push or pull air with no problems, also we found that connection before after dont matter what else is needed to know use of this unit for a year no problem. We just felt that to use it on a block of time was essentially needed for proper review 👍
customer_reviews.author: thomas

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Well the first 2 I ordered worked great for about 2 years then I ordered a new one it came on time but fan was either broken or used it had a really bad rattling sound when turned on this is the second time i have ordered this fan and had to ruturn it do to this issue ..... going to think about a new product to order lately I am disappointed with vivonsun products ....
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Fan is great. Mount may be a bit to contend with.
customer_reviews.text: Real heavy duty construction. Very quiet compared to many other fans I've used like this. The mounting bracket is difficult to deal with as the fan itself sits over where the screws need to go into the wall.Screws have to go in at an angle.
customer_reviews.author: bdmeyer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality fan.
customer_reviews.text: Used this as a blower going into a hot water heat exchanger off my boiler for heating a bedroom. Installed under the house you can barely hear the fan running at full speed.
customer_reviews.author: D. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after less than 2 months... JUNK
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 of these, one has stopped working in less than 2 months. Fan won't spin, just makes a humming sound. I have other fans from other companies that have last me years, this junk didn't even make it two months. Spend your money elsewhere! Zero Customer Service!
customer_reviews.author: Patti

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this product is very good, which completely conforms to the seller's description. I like it very much. This is completely unexpected. Solved my big trouble. This is a satisfactory shopping experience.
customer_reviews.author: J.S. McFarland

customer_reviews.title: Update: great customer service. Replaced defective item immediately.
customer_reviews.text: Hav had this fan for less than 5 months and it has become extremely loud as if the bearings have completely worn out. It's too bad too because it worked great, until it didn't. $90 is too much for a fan that doesn't make it half of a year Update: customer service got back to me and replaced the unit quickly. The replacement is running great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Malin

customer_reviews.title: Works but doesn’t last long
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this fan continuously since August 2017 at a very low speed, lower than the factory speed control will go. The fan has progressively gotten louder and here I am in April 2018 and believe this needs to be replaced. Worked well while it lasted but not good for continuous duty.
customer_reviews.author: Vince F

customer_reviews.title: Must buy.
customer_reviews.text: Omg this thing moves some air. A bit big for my 2x4 but i am planing on an upgrade here very shortly. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Very noisy
customer_reviews.text: Hard to mount to wall. Screws are obstructed by the fan housing. Mounting plate is too short. Very noisy after just 2 weeks of running fan.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Ryan

customer_reviews.title: almost 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on 1-22-2020 and on 4-10-2020 it stop working. Update after getting a hold of vivosun they reimbursed me for the fan. Was real easy to deal with them
customer_reviews.author: Rose Joiner

customer_reviews.title: Pretty quiet 6" inline fan with variable speed controller
customer_reviews.text: Great product...just got the 6" inline fan and tested it. I thought that it would be louder but it is super quiet. Sounds comparable to a furnace turning on. It comes with a leather case and has a variable speed control.
customer_reviews.author: L Vang

customer_reviews.title: powerful
customer_reviews.text: Pleased with quality and performance. Noise level is low and after one month of continuous usage all is good.
customer_reviews.author: GJM

customer_reviews.title: Working great
customer_reviews.text: I use it to remove VOC's and airborne sawdust in my wood shop. Wife has stopped complaining about the smell coming into the living area.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: It’s a hell of a fan
customer_reviews.text: This puppy has some kick to it. I can’t speak to its longevity, but for the here and now, it’s as good a value as I could find on six inch inline fans and seems sturdier and more powerful than the similarly priced other six inch inline I have (though can’t complain about that one either, really).
customer_reviews.author: N

customer_reviews.title: great fan
customer_reviews.text: love this fan its reasonably quiet, efficient and priced very competitively, am using to exhaust wood shop into a filter system that is working flawlessly. Unit came fast and is built well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, moves a lot of air. Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: Quiet, moves a lot of air, very easy to install. Unfortunately I had a small glitch with mine but the company, Vivosun, reached out to me and made things right very quickly. I would not hesitate to buy another Vivosun product and only wish that other companies would provide the same level of customer service.
customer_reviews.author: D.S.

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: A little noisier then it says but awesome product well worth your money
customer_reviews.author: Ghostx710

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend using the included bracket to mount it to something
customer_reviews.text: Quiet fan, powerful, built in speed control, no complaints. Although the fan is heavy enough to stand on its own at full blast, I would recommend using the included bracket to mount it to something.
customer_reviews.author: Grant Woodruff

customer_reviews.title: Running 24/7 since purchased almost 2 years ago
customer_reviews.text: Great build, good suction, low noise level. Its been running for almost 2 years and no problems, very happy with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: It's was supposed to be dubble packed wasn't supposed to be able to see what's in the box
customer_reviews.text: Broke in a month I believe it was missing handled by shipping
customer_reviews.author: Marceau Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Lifetime Vivosun Inline Fan User
customer_reviews.text: Love Vivosun's variable speed inline fans! I've order multiple 6" and 8" fans and they've all ran without fault or rattle/squeal for 2 years now! Some working as crispers in tents and and running nonstop, i'm sold! Lifetime vivosun inline fan user! Cheap and dependable!
customer_reviews.author: John Johnson

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after about six months. Just makes a loud scary sound now. -_- Edit: Vivosun replaced the fan for me. Yay 😀.
customer_reviews.author: OG

customer_reviews.title: The vibration is driving me nuts and getting worse each day
customer_reviews.text: At first it worked great but after a couple of weeks it's developed a vibration and hums loudly. I tried placing it on rubber isolators, it looked like a high quality product but it's not going to last as the vibration is driving me nuts and getting worse each day.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Brown

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, noise tolerable.
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up for my 4x4 grow tent. Even on lowest setting then negative pressure is STRONG. Be wary if your tent is made of thin material or has crappy zippers-it will cause it to capsize.
customer_reviews.author: MelissaRN

customer_reviews.title: Good Exhaust Fan
customer_reviews.text: Good fan. Pros: powerful, well made, inexpensive. Cons: noisy, can only be slowed down to about 80 per cent of the rpms (this is subjective as I did not perform scientific tests).
customer_reviews.author: Handyman

customer_reviews.title: alot of air a little noisy unbalanced
customer_reviews.text: this blower moves a lot of air it is not as quiet as I thought it would be and I think if the impeller was balanced that would help. I don't use this as much as most would use it but I believe that the imbalance will cause the bearing to fail faster than one that is better balanced
customer_reviews.author: Shawn vp

customer_reviews.title: It is what it says.
customer_reviews.text: It works just not a beast. But it dont cost as much as a beast so. Good fan. Forest for tents! Witch what is was for. Kinda surprised I got do many lights and love there tents. Good company!
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: 2 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 2 weeks, just stoped it is on but no air is coming through it and I have to unplug it and plug it back in to get the fan on! Annoyed it not the word! I sent mine in for exchange hopefully second one will last long or Im done with this company
customer_reviews.author: Darth Gator

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 4 months :(
customer_reviews.text: Product is fantastic but only held up for 4 months... would be nice to get a new one. Please n thank u
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product. Can't beat the price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Can't beat the price. Would probably pay 150-200 for the same quality from a shop. I would believe the 740cfm to be correct, if not, pretty damn close. Haven't had to use it much, so I can't testify to it's longevity yet. Only one small critique would be that I would have liked to see a lower pressure for the variable settings. I have 11x13 room with four 1000w and its more than enough. Actually, have it on a timer with variable set to low.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING duct fan
customer_reviews.text: AMAZING duct fan. Super quiet yet SUPER powerful. Using it for a residential duct booster. Love this thing, worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Eric and Kristi

customer_reviews.title: Great deal.
customer_reviews.text: I am going to use this device to cool my attic. My attic did not have any vents in the eves. I am planning to pull air into the attic through a vent for the kitchen stove. I will hold open the flapper valve with a wire. The air will exhaust through the ridge vent.
customer_reviews.author: james francisco

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Very nosy fan Made in China.I does not perform well.I got it in july 8 and today is october 7 and bearing start make rattle noise.Total China made Trash!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: works grate will replace all of my fans with this ...
customer_reviews.text: works grate will replace all of my fans with this one very quite when speed controller is turn to 50% I can barely hear it running UPDATE: Fan now sounds like some thing is grinding and banging, New on Feb-17 bad on Jan-18 I WILL NOT BUY ANY MORE OF THIS BRAND
customer_reviews.author: C. Blanchette

customer_reviews.title: I do love this fan
customer_reviews.text: I do love this fan..I use this fan in the 2×4×6 grow tent with two viparspectra 300W LED lights.It keeps the tent around 75F° to 80F° which is what I wanted for my peppers and tomato seedlings. If you are not sure what to buy, just buy this one and Vivosun has the best customer service second to none.
customer_reviews.author: Thyseer(Tulsa,OK)

customer_reviews.title: Awesome products that are built to last
customer_reviews.text: Vivosun comes through again. I have this 6" fan on the exhaust and a vivosun 4" on my intake. Keeps the tent at 70 degrees. Awesome products that are built to last.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: Good and good support
customer_reviews.text: Have a 5x5 Grow Tent and This fan was doing really really well with moving the air in it for my babies!!! :D so good can!! But it's only been 4.5 to 5 months and stopped working... After speaking with customer service they have helped me graciously with this product!!
customer_reviews.author: CMDR_AJ

product_meta.title: VIVOSUN 8 Inch 740 CFM Inline Duct Ventilation Fan with Variable Speed Controller for Grow Tent
feature_bullets: POWERFUL AIR FLOW: Heavy hitting blower with a fan speed of 2450 RPM for an air flow of 740 CFM. Moves air through your target location efficiently for optimal ventilation.
RUNS SMOOTH AND QUIET: Powerful fan puts out only 53 dB noise level. Fine-tuned for minimum vibration with a sturdy vegan leather cover that further muffles any sound or vibration.

DURABLE BUILD: Galvanized steel parts come factory painted to resist atmospheric corrosion from humidity. Tight, precise construction eliminates rattling and reduces wear and tear to give the element a long life.

HIGH TECH DESIGN: The aerodynamically designed centrifugal impeller of this unit delivers strong air flow with a disproportionately low sound profile. Fitted with a variable speed controller and dual flanges for hassle free hookup
VERSATILE APPLICATIONS: Ideal for cooling lighting fixtures or controlling hot and humid conditions in grow tents/rooms.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars776 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
